thread.title: Farage and Rees-Mogg are going for a Wetherspoons together as part of a Devon Brexit rally - Devon Live

author: Colleen Smith
title: Farage and Rees-Mogg are going for a Wetherspoons together as part of a Devon Brexit rally - Devon Live
text:
Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A Save Brexit rally is arriving in Devon this weekend with three of the campaign's most prominent public figures taking to the stage - former UKIP leader Nigel Farage, posh Tory MP Jacob Rees-Mogg and Wetherspoons' pub chain boss Tim Martin.
The three will share the stage at a rally on Saturday, October 13 at Torquay's Riviera International Centre as part of a nationwide tour of ‘Chuck Chequers’ rallies.
Nigel Farage will arrive ahead of the 2pm rally on the Leave Means Leave campaign bus.
He will meet fishermen at 10am on Torquay Harbour before going on walkabout.
The walkabout will end at The Green Ginger Wetherspoons pub on Fleet Walk. The rally at the conference centre runs from 2pm to 4pm. Read More
The Save Brexit Rally campaign said: "Politicians from across the political spectrum will be uniting for a series of UK wide mass rallies protesting the Prime Minister’s Chequers plan." Toff with Jacob Rees-Mogg (Image: Instagram)
Rees-Mogg, whose constituency is Midsomer Norton in Somerset has previously announced he is a fan of Wetherspoons pubs for their "good English food at good value".
It's not known if he will be meeting his number one fan - I’m a Celebrity... queen, Torquay’s own Georgia Toffolo . She recently met Rees-Mogg to apologise for calling him a ‘sex god’ after she got the chance to talk to the ‘rather dishy’ MP in the Houses of Parliament. Tim Martin, founder and chairman of JD Wetherspoon at George's Meeting House, Exeter
Brexiteer Tim Martin, owner of the JD Wetherspoons chain , has previously announced that his pubs will slash the number of European drinks and increase British-made booze.
Former UKIP leader Farage is hosting another event in Devon later this year. ‘ An audience with Nigel Farage’ will take place at Exmouth Pavilions on November 16 when the politician will talk about his life and career, as well as a Q&A session with the audience with tickets costing up to £45.
